Lubbock.Lubbock Memorial Civic Center:
The Lubbock Memorial Civic Center is a convention center located in Lubbock, Texas. It was built in 1977 and dedicated to the memory of local residents who died in a 1970 tornado that struck the site of the center. Inside the convention center, which was recently refurbished at a cost of $2 million, are the following facilities:
A 40,000-square-foot (4,000 m2) exhibit hall which also doubles as a 2,995-seat indoor arena and can be used for sporting events, trade shows, conventions, banquets, and concerts (maximum capacity 4,914).
